item.title: [317]Math Command[317]
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:362634”]Well this can be done much better, let me see if I can work it out.
EDIT:

if (command.startsWith("math")) { double add, sub, div, mul; String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int input1 = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int input2 = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); add = input1+input2; sub = input1-input2; div = input1/input2; mul = input1*input2; sM(""+input1+" with "+input2+" is:"); sM("Add: "+add+"."); sM("Sub: "+sub+"."); sM("Div: "+div+"."); sM("Mul: "+mul+"."); } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::math 1 1"); } } Now you dont need to make it 6 digits. Use it as:

::math 5 5
and it will say:

5 with 5 is: Add: 10.0 Sub: 0.0 Div: 1.0 Mul: 25.0[/quote]

Ooh thank you, as I said I just got back into RSPS and such and didn’t know much. I will use this method from now on…

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Math Command[317]
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Well this can be done much better, let me see if I can work it out.
EDIT:

if (command.startsWith("math")) { double add, sub, div, mul; String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int input1 = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int input2 = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); add = input1+input2; sub = input1-input2; div = input1/input2; mul = input1*input2; sM(""+input1+" with "+input2+" is:"); sM("Add: "+add+"."); sM("Sub: "+sub+"."); sM("Div: "+div+"."); sM("Mul: "+mul+"."); } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::math 1 1"); } } Now you dont need to make it 6 digits. Use it as:

::math 5 5
and it will say:

5 with 5 is: Add: 10.0 Sub: 0.0 Div: 1.0 Mul: 25.0

Read full topic

learn to read you little purplehead
[/quote]This ^^

I don’t know what it’s for but it’s pretty cool I guess…[/quote]

Just a little command I made, the inputs must have 6 digits each, so if you wanted 1 + 2 it’d be ‘::add 000001 000002’ I just got back into Java so I’m not very good.

item.title: [317]Math Command[317]
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

Creator: Pure Demons
Difficulty: 1/1000000
Base Used: InvalidScape (Cleaned AllStar)


– STEP 1 –
Go into ‘client.java’ and add this to your command section:

if (command.startsWith("math")) { try { int input1 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5,11)); int input2 = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12, 18)); int res1, res2, res3;, res4; res1 = input1 + input2; res2 = input1 - input2; res3 = input1 * input2; res4 = input1 / input2; String[] messages = {input1+" + "+input2+" is.."+res1, input1+" - "+input2+" is.."+res2, input1+" * "+input2+" is.."+res3, input1+" / "+input2+" is.."+res4, "ERROR: Invalid Integers."}; if (input1 >= 0) { sendMessage(messages[0]); sendMessage(messages[1]); sendMessage(messages[2]); sendMessage(messages[3]); } else { sendMessage(messages[4]); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("ERROR: Unknown Syntax"); sendMessage("USE.. ::math 000001 000002"); } }

– HOW TO USE –
Go into game after saving and compiling, and type ‘::math 001000 001500’ (Must have 6 digits in each int.) and it will return:

Example:

I MADE THIS CAUSE I WAS BORED.

EDIT: This is very basic math…Division doesn’t work…if you want it to work convert the int to a double.

Read full topic
